name: RollerCoaster Tycoon®: Deluxe
description: RollerCoaster Tycoon Deluxe takes you for a ride in the original RollerCoaster Tycoon and its expansion packs, Corkscrew Follies and Loopy Landscapes. Create the ultimate theme park using a variety of coaster types with giant loops and barrel rolls and in-park attractions like suspended monorails and water-soaked plume rides.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Windows Vista Processor: 1.8 GHz Processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 3D graphics card compatible with DirectX 7 DirectX: Version 7.0 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: 'Your Mother looks too intense for me' 'Just thinking about Your Mother makes me feel sick' 'I want to get off Your Mother' 'I've been standing in line for Your Mother for ages'  10/10

As a game from my childhood, I may or may not hold some bias in favor of this game. However, this will not be evident in my review. Let's answer some questions.  'What is this game?'  Rollercoaster Tycoon is a franchise where the player becomes an amusement park owner with the power to create tracks, customize everything from the terrain and decor to the ride names and colors, and even charging people to use the BATHROOM. Great idea. Think the sims, but without families and more workers and rides.  'Any ACTUAL skills I can get from this game?'  Yes. Balancing out a budget is seen by the money amount you are given in loans. These allow you to buy rides, stands, construct in general, advertise, et cetera. These loans CAN be paid off so you can run the park and not have your money taken away every month for loans. Also, there is keeping things cleaned/organized. The park gets awards based on how you run it, ranging from 'Safest Park in The Country' to 'Worst Looking Park'. In order to keep good PR, you want to hire some handymen who sweep up all the vomit and trash people leave lying around.  'Anything popular come out of this game?'  I WANT TO GET OFF MR.BONES' WILD RIDE I WANT TO GET OFF MR.BONES' WILD RIDE I WANT TO GET OFF MR.BONES' WILD RIDE I WANT TO GET OFF MR.BONES' WILD RIDE  'Why not just RCT3?'  RCT3 is just, eh. It's hard to explain. RCT3 is not a bad game at all, trust me, I own that one as well and its fantastic. But, it will never have the same bouncy feel the early ones do. RCT3 is more calming and orderly. RCT 1 and 2 are bouncy, chaotic, and generally more enjoyable. In the earlier games, you get more of a RCT feel and less of a Sims. The gui in RCT3 even looks like the Sims. Still tho, try both and see which is your cup of tea.  'DLC?'   get out   'Any bugs?'  The game is being updated constantly due to being on steam, mainly in language support from what I've seen, but that doesn't mean its lost some if its old bugs. Sometimes, mechanics pay no attention to rides and they just get fixed on their own by some means. Guests still just wander off park when you delete the path they're on instead of finding another path. RCT was made in 1999, so its not really a suprise when these things happen. You just have to push them in the right direction and it's all figured out (by that I mean pick them up and throw them at the ride's enterance until they get it RIGHT).  'Is the music good?'   Holy ♥♥♥♥, yes.   You can set music differently for each ride, so if you don't appreciate one song, just pick another!  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------  Basically, get this game. You will not regret it.

As a kid I would always start off every park I made by hiring 5 or so handymen, in preparation for the onslaught of puke and overfilled garbage bins the park would soon be plagued with. And yet, I always made sure to remove the 'mow grass' from their job descriptions; keeping it meant your handymen would be off mowing instead of doing everything else. And yet, I always felt bad for the grass; was it really right to neglect it, simply because of a minor inconveniance to my park? So I always hired one more than I needed, and made his only job being to mow grass. 35$ monthly, earned solely through his sweat and his lawnmower. Off in the unexplored regions of the park, where nobody can even see the grass he's mowing. I always made sure to give him a absurd name.  Around 10 years later, I find myself tracking Dorkle's adventure through the wilderness, chronicling his neverending battle against the grass, as I try to find a good spot for the next ferris wheel.  10/10 would relive cherised childhood memories again.
One of a very short list of games that made up my childhood. Still holds up against a large portion of games out there today.  Personal Rating: 10/10

Definitely takes me back to when I was a kid and first got into PC gaming. If you enjoy building, this is the game for you. If you enjoy management, this is the game for you. If you love charging people $20 to go the the bathroom, or sending them to their doom on death coasters, than this is DEFINITELY the game for you.
Dug hole, filled with water, killed sad panda.  10/10 would childhood again.
Old game I used to play as a kid, bought it again about a year ago. Never forgot how much fun I had with this game.

For a game that was released over 15 years ago, it's amazing to still have such an impact on a gaming community and still be entertaining. I can't think of many other games that people actually still play on a daily basis because it's still as fun as it was released so many years ago and also able to compete with today's similar games. I can only hope that the new coming RCT World will be worthy of stepping in the footsteps of this magnificent game.

One of the best games ever made, quite possibly my favorite game ever. The colorful, cartoon style keeps this 1999 title from showing its age. Honestly I think a new player could pick up this classic theme park builder and enjoy it just as much as a longtime fan. RCT is relaxing, non-rage-inducing, and endlessly creative; what more could you ask for in a game?
Came free with Cheerios  10/10
Great sim game, even after all these years.
if you hate this game i dump you into the water of my park. 100/10 no toliet for you also.
Steam's making real progress on acquiring the great PC games of my childhood! The nostalgia trip will be complete when they get original The Sims...

The best classic game ever!  More realistic than you might think: -Attractions break down (and might even crash) -Reliability and popularity decreases over time -Guests won't ride too intense coasters -View the cash spend and remaining of every single guest -Start with noting, take a loan and make profit -Set ride fees according to ride popularity and entry fee -A lot of choices: free attractions/high park entry fee or free entry/expensive rides (or ask money for both ofcourse, which is not possible in RCT2) -Small trains lose speed faster than long trains, and rollercoasters are faster with guests riding on it -Advertising your park brings a lot a new visitors -Cheaper coaster types attract less guests -Choose what you want to research -Design your coasters correctly to make it worth every single cent -Understand your guests, and become the ultimate rollercoaster tycoon! A must have for any strategy fan!  (is there any way to add the hundreds hours played on the cd-version to my play time?)
Guest logic: -'I'm not hungry' -Eats hamburger -Throws wrapper on the ground -'God, the litter here is horrible!' 1,000,000/10 goty

It's easy to see the hours tick away while playing this game. There's so much to do, and when you think you're done, you see something else that has to be done. This game runs on any computer, so get it now or when it goes on sale.
Why are you looking at reviews? Everyone knows this game is a classic. If you enjoy this genre, you'll like this game.
Old-skool Rollercoaster Tycoon! Nostalgia is everywhere and the game is still addictive :D
Brings back childhood. Good times.
The classic coaster builder that started it all for me.

Though my hours on this game are few though steam, I have logged many MANY, hours playing this as a child and even growing up. Making coasters and parks, trying to complete the objectives while making sure your not breaking the bank is strangly addicting. It is a game that has aged very well and continues to be just as addicting as when I was a child. I consider it a must have.
Classic game. Save menus are straight out of windows 98.

Were you a child once who went to a daycare after school that only had one old PC with Windows XP SP1 and had a few games? Said games being the Backyard series, Oregon Trail, SimCity 4, and RCT? Congrats, here is your childhood.  The best part of this? It has Loopy Landscapes AND Corckscrew Follies BUILT IN! No more burning it from the disc at a friends house secretly to take back to your house and install!  It even has the resizing bug! 10/10

This was an essential part of my childhood. I remember basking in the glow of my old CRT monitor and gleefully building rides and attractions to stuff more people into my pixilated dream park.   Now I sit down to play this game and feel that same happiness at seeing my guests throw their money into my ever-growing coffers. It seems a lot easier to win the scenarios now that I am older (and presumably wiser). At the very least Roller Coaster Tycoon Deluxe is a fun nostalgia trip.

For me, a person who has play this back during it's early release, this game does not lose its fun easily. The scenarios may be very easy for awhile, but overall it is very fun and enjoyable, and a good learning experience for those who like to build their own rides within the game! Anyway, let's get to the breakdown for it.  Gameplay: 7.5/10  This game holds a simple but fun hold of its gameplay. To keep it short and simple, it takes the standard overview 'god' role to building things, and allows you to monitor everything and do as you will. While it is a relatively common style, it fits well.  Sound: 8/10  The roller-coasters available in this game for the most part have very good sounds built around them, as is the music of the rides you can choose. However, the smaller rides (minus the Haunted house and rides without a cart and/or moving vehicle) like the Ferris wheel and the Merry-Go-Round have no sound around them if the music is turned off. Whether it was intentional or not, it's not really that big of the deal, the sound still is very good.  Graphics: 9/10  For its time, the graphics were built very high-end, especially the rides. The detail put around the scenery and the texture of the land is pretty amazing for its original release, but the people seem to have been left out of this small loop, like they have gotten just a tad bit lazy. It's not really that bad though, and is truly a great sight for its age!  Controls: 6/10  The controls consist of a simple click-and-go kinda game. For the most part that is it, but you can hot-key many things, like closing windows, screenshots, opening the tabs available and even for seeing through the ground. The hot-keying is almost a necessity for those looking to do things very quickly, as the clicking can be very burdensome when doing many things you are trying to do. The hot-keys save it, though.  Overall: 7.6/10 (Pretty Good)  This game certainly holds its head up high for those who look into tycoon games from many angles. A few things here and there can get a little bothering, but overall it's a solid slate, and I would recommend it for anyone willing to try it out!
mass murder at its finest
NostalgiaCoaster Tycoon
I have always loved this game

After 10+ years of not having this game, I was delighted to have the oppurtunity to get this masterpiece of a game on Steam. Nothing like cleaning up barf around every spot of the theme park while trying not to propel every person on a roller coaster off into their immediate death. All in all, this is a classic theme-park build up type game with many different options and variables being thrown which way at you. I promise I wont make you pay 50$ just to get on the ferris wheel, I swear.
Old but gold, should win the test of time award!
LOVE THIS GAME! such a great memory of my childhood!

Without doubt, this is one of tbest tycoon games I have ever played.  I first played this game when it was released back in 2000 and recently discovered it on Steam and fell in love with it again.  The game is basically management of a theme park, which you build, either from scratch or from a starting point, depending on the scenario. You add rides, rollercoasters, eateries, facilities, etc. You must recruit handymen (absolutely vital as the park guests hate the site of sick on the ground!), engineers (your rides will breakdown regularly) & security guards (vandals exist you know).  The best aspect though, is the designing of your rides. Some are set, such as the Merry Go Round, but others, such as all the rollercoasters, the log flume etc, you can either accept pre set designs or have a go yourself. Piece by piece. There is no better reward than the self design of a monster rollercoaster that the crowds love.  I use Windows 8.2 and this game runs smoothly.  Buy this game.

A great blast from the past game that I had a lot of fun with in my childhood, and continue to occassionally play now. Let's you really make your own theme park the way you want too while offering some very challenging scenarios.  PROS:  Lots of Levels  Plenty of Ride Designs you can create Retro Graphics and 'old game feel' while not taking away from the game itself Overall, just a very fun game  Cons: Time can be a bit repetive, a year in game takes an hour of real life time while playing, which some scenarious can take up to 4 years and can be a bit long/repetitive
One of the Best games ever made. Peace

THIS GAME IS THE GAME I ALWAYS PLAYED!    If u wanna play a game. than u must play this Nostalgia game from 1999. stil the top3 games i played when I was 6. this game is 3 years younger than me!   Funny game to play!
I purchased this for nastalgic reasons and it delivered. Actually got into playing this classic. Fun time waster!
My Childhood game!

Don't let an abysmal final entry draw you away from the series. RCT1 is as good a game as it always has been, and I daresay it's one of the greatest ever made. When Steam offered the nomination for the 'Test of Time' award, I thought very briefly of X-COM... then ignored that thought and went straight here. Then I took that award back, so I could give it to the game again.  ==  Made by a single person, and with NO ENGINE (the entire game is written in Assembly), Chris Sawyer's Rollercoaster Tycoon 1 and 2 fall under the definition of a masterpiece. They play well, run smoothly, and have all sorts of great features that other tgames wouldn't catch up to for years. When SimCity 2000 and 3000, and even 4 were simply running cities with fake-people sprites occasionally walking around, RCT had something only Bullfrog had succeeded in-- a management game with AGENTS.    Every single one of the people in your park are active.  When they're idle and bored, they find something else to do, and the guest count can reach well beyond even 1000 guests. They're never inactive, the performance never tanks; it pulls off the simulation of thousands flawlessly. IN 1998!  What makes this game stand out so much from older titles, however, is the clean interface and visuals. The isometric graphics still hold up rather well. The performance is at a stable framerate constantly, and while I'm not sure where this cap sits, it's at least 40 FPS and never drops. The interface is neatly organized, and every time you click a menu, it IMMEDIATELY pulls up that menu with an accompanying sound. It also behaves like Windows, with windows appearing per menu that can be dragged around the screen freely. It actually LOOKS like a game instead of an alien interface, something that can't be said about other classics like X-COM and Theme Hospital.  Perhaps what draws me to the game the most, however, is how you're genuinely building a world in it. It doesn't have much in terms of background music, and at first, the park  feels  empty; however, you start placing your rides, give them selective background music, and extend your park. This music adds up to build an atmosphere. Then, your new guests will make noise. You'll hear the clanging of capitalism and greed every time a customer buys something, and your guests are louder depending on how many there are. Coasters going downhill with passengers will have them scream. You'll also see them very well-animated-- they'll walk around, they'll pull out umbrellas   if they bought one for $20 at one of our kiosks... heh heh  , they'll throw up if they get sick. Yeah, their 'tasks?' All based on their own selfish desires. They'll want to be happy, need to be awake, need to use the bathroom, and can't take motion sickness. Their actions all change based on these stats, and it's in your best interest to accompany them all.  In reality, I'm making the game sound more complex than it is to play. These mechanics are slowly introduced to you, and I played this at a very young age without a tutorial; it just doesn't suffer from the usual complexity problems of these old games. If you need it, there's a tutorial that consists of watching someone play in real time, essentially a demo of Chris Sawyer taking over the mouse and playing for you. You can hit Escape to take control at any time, but assuming you don't you'll get to see where all the options you need are. In reality, however, the game won't take too long to figure out for the most part.  As far as replayability value goes, you just shouldn't be concerned. There's several challenges to go around, playing with the game rules in various ways by giving you a task and either a piece of land to build on or a prebuilt park in its early stages to improve. You will NOT run out of content-- in all my years of playing this game, I still have yet to clear through all the scenarios, and Forest Frontiers will always be a special memory to me. ==================== BUY THIS GAME. It hasn't aged at all. It's still better than any modern sim... SimCity 5, Cities Skylines, and Planet Coaster all fall short in some areas that this game nails, despite all being good games themselves. Its compatibility is near-perfect (and if by some odd chance you run into an issue, there's a lengthy guide detailing workarounds and solutions), and a hexeditor widescreen hack is out there if you need it.  If I don't end the review here, I would ramble endlessly about all the things this game does right, but as it stands the best way to do that is to experience it yourself. The Steam release is a simple port, true, but nonetheless the game looks and runs perfectly. It still  is  a highly innovative and organized game, and few things stand in the way of showing off its strengths.   Pick it up, for your own good, and try it yourself; whether it's the full track editor allowing you to build custom rides and coasters, the atmosphere-building sound design and gameplay design decisions that help it feel like a living world, the management of your finances and distribution of staff to keep the park at max efficiency, or the morbid prospect of drowning panda-costumed staff and throwing coasters into the lake, or perhaps any combination of the two, this is a game you simply must play.
i remember playing this game when i was like 5. now that i saw it on steam it was a instant buy for me and even a game that was for windows 95 it runs perfecly on windows 8 and windows 7

I love this game. I grew up playing this on my father's Windows 98 machine and to be able to play this again on modern hardware is amazing. That aside, it's much better than Roller Coaster Tycoon 3. Having yet to play RCT2, I am willing to go as far as to say that this is the best of the trilogy. Yes, the rides and amusements are a bit dated, but that doesn't take away from the fun.  There is no game speed change like in RCT3, but one park year is about 1 hour. This won't stop you from doing the scenarios in one sitting as they vary from 1 year to 5 years.
Played this game in 2007. Brings back so many memories!! Great game!!  10/10 Would recommend.
Built a shuttle loop rollercoaster that took off at 60MPH and launched 24 guests into the air. They crashed and exploded.  10/10

This game is amazing. I really can't even completely describe how good of a game it is. Sure it has its flaws but for a game made in 1999, it really astounds me. I used to play some of the other RCT games when I was younger so I've always been familiar with these games but I never had a chance to play the first one. It's really a fantastic game with loads of features that I didn't expect in a 16+ year old game. It'll definitely keep you entertained for hours if you like management games with lots of freedom to build how you want. It's definitely worth the price.

Roller Coaster Tycoon is among my favorite games of all time, i played the crap out of this game as a kid . . and i still never get tired of it.  I think its safe to say that Id have about 1500-2000 hours on this game if steam counted the hours i spend into this game when i was a kid.

Three classic RollerCoaster Tycoon titles in one package! That's a nearly endless amount of hours of addicting theme-park building (the first pack took me nearly 60 hours to complete)! It's easy to get into, yet offers lots of depth. You won't want to stop playing. This version has as a few visual problems on modern versions of Windows, but nothing that makes the game unplayable.
I loved this game so much as a kid, Bought it out of Nostalgia. It's every bit as good as I remembered, love it. Definitely worth the price
This game is amazing, I remember playing it as a kid, fun time drowning peo-what? nah, I only drowned those I had to, but I loved making roller coasters ^_^

I played this when I was 7, and it's still very good. Enough said.  In all seriousness, nostalgia does cloud our perception, and I don't play a lot of simulation games, so I may not be the best person to review this game since I don't have much to compare it to. I haven't played more than a few minutes of the sequels and games by other companies inspired by the series like Planet Coaster. Those are probably a better option if you're looking for a modern experience, as this game definitely is a bit dated. Still, for its age, I don't feel that the UI is too clunky or the learning curve is too steep. Fun to pick up for a couple hours exactly once, or to dump days into, if you have that kind of time.  I never did fully understand a lot of the roller coaster-specific mechanics, like intensity and excitement, which can be limiting when I'm trying to make a park the best it can be. The track builder is a bit clunky, too. Still, I'm a lot better at the budgeting and management aspects than I was when I was a kid, and the game can still be easy or challenging depending on the scenario. The quirks and flaws are a drop in the bucket of nostalgic goodness. Or lake. Lake of goodness, which your guests can fall into and drown.
The classic Rollercoaster Tycoon. Always a fun game.
Even to this day its worth every cent
still a good game, crashes A LOT though. You'll probably want to save every 20mins or so because there's no autosave and you will cry when you lose 3 hours of progress :'(

Nostalgica to the max! I played this game when I was little and it still is super fun.  I can't get enough of the Merry-Go-Around breaking down, going in full speed including the music.  One downside of the game is the resolution. You can play fullscreen but it makes everything very tiny to click on, so I just play it in a smaller window. This does result in another issue, the edgescrolling don't work anymore then.    Still a really good game and very fun to play!

Brings back a lot of great memorys! Unlike the CD version there are no problems whatsoever getting the steam version to fully funtioning under Windows. No save break downs, no problems with playing in window mode, just great!
This game is a classic I highly recommend it to anyone who hasn't played it before.

Only those familiar will likely like it. For those that are familiar, easy to waste hours and hours. It has its flaws, Worth every penny to me.

I owned this game on cd years ago when Windows XP was the computer to have but unfortunately my copy of the game broke. I am glad to see and play this again, brings back many memories of spending countless hours of building rollercoasters, rides and running my own amusement park.

Oh gosh, this game. It's fun. REALLY RUN.   RollerCoaster Tycoon is about a game where you make rollercoasters or more specifically amusement parks who have rollercoasters in them. Your goal is to reach a certain amount of guests or park rating, among other things.   The gameplay is simple. Make attractions, like rollercoasters, Go Karts, Log Flumes, etc., so your park can become more popular. You can charge people for many things, including to use the bathroom, which can be hilarious when they really need to go, but don't want to. However, doing things like that can make completing your objective harder, because people will complain about it, which will bring your park rating down. However, you can drown the unhappy people, which will bring your park rating up for some reason.   However, there are some downsides. For example, on my laptop, almost EVERYTIME you close the game, my computer doesn't recognize any touches and FORCES you to shut down by using the power button. Also, the guests are WAY too scared. I made a rollercoaster that just goes down by not that much and it had an intensity meter of 11 and nobody would ride it, even though I made it free and advertised it. Also, NEVER save on the same save file. I did that and it stopped working, which was a world I spent 6 hours on.  Final Verdict: 8/10 +Fun +Replay Value +Years of entertainment +Addicting -Guests way too scared
Still after all this time a fun game to play! Loved it then, love it now.

The pinnacle of Chris Sawyer's series. I spent many hours playing this game as a child. I recommend this game to all age groups.

My very first game for the PC all those years back, 15 years ago. CD's were damaged and would no longer work. Bought them again but couldn't work with newer software of todauy.   Performance wise so far is absolutely amazing. Everything works. Saving. Loading. Etc.  Was not the original tycoon game, but RollerCoaster Tycoon set the bar for all future tycoon games to come. And it's on sale for only €3 at the moment, which is inclusive of its two expansion packs. An absolute steal.
An amazing childhood classic.

Put a 'Do not enter Sign' right next to the entrance. No one leaves my park.  Took all the angry people and put them in a 4 by 4 rehabilitation camp. The camp was overrun with water shortly after.  Built a water slide, the rafts exploded upon hitting the ground. (Michael Bay Style)  Built a Roller Coaster, 20 died and I realized I didn't finish the roller coaster.

Works well and is just like I remembered it no problems with saving or anything on Windows 8 atleast. although alt-tabbing is not friendly so if you insist on alt-tabbing beware. otherwise buy it for the sake of everything. sweet memories of your childhood await. (hopefully)
It's on Steam now, awesome, now it can track the depressing amount of time I spend playing this game.

Granted I never got to actually play rollercoaster tycoon when it was first released, I still found the game to be extremely enjoyable. The controls are simple and for the most part, you can play the whole thing with just a mouse. I'm glad this was finally released on steam.

Good game to relax with. Would appreciate support for unlimited sandbox though.

If you've played RCT 3 and never played its 2d predecessors, then your missing out.  Play this, its gold.  Very little bugs, simple 2d platform, provides an excellent 'themepark managing simulation' experience. This game has a surprising ammount of depth to it.  Weather its your paths are disgusting and guests are complaing, people are getting lost, vandalism in the park, or the rides being too expensive. There is ALWAYS something to be done.  - A very relaxed game, something you would probably want to play just to waste a few hours.   ++nostalgic feel  ++ only 6$ ++ well over 80 hours
build 10 shuttle loops  turn the launch speed for them all up to full blast open them all for free at the same time
Old school are awesome sometimes :)
My childhood in one game.  Good old times. :')

Please do not let the time fool you I have hundreds of hours in this game. Have had this game on disc since it came out. This game is absolutely great. People I see complaining about 'no remastering, no retouching, nothing new' can honestly go to [redacted]. This game doesn't need it. It was great back then, and it is still great now. It may be simple and it may have its issues, but that is honestly what makes it great.   The parks and their objectives range from easy to challenging. What is better however is playing the parks after the objectives conclude. Some of them have so much expansion room that you can double or triple the size of the original park. Honestly, many of the parks only come into their own after the objectives have been completed because if you stay with them, what you can research and what you can build is just great.   The only reason I have the steam version, plus low time, is because it was on sale and because I wanted to play them on my newer computers. Still have an old XP desktop with my original game and about 90% of the parks unlocked.
Somehow, over a decade later, the charm is still here.  REALLY ANNOYING when it crashes after a 3 hour play session as you're trying to save, though.

I've been playing this since I was about 7 or 8, and it's still fun to play even 10 years later. If you're looking for nostalgia, or just want to get into the series, start with this game. It's so fun.
One of my favorite games from my childhood. Works fairly well. Sometimes there's a little hiccup when I exit the game but it's pretty stable for the most part considering.
Brings back childhood memories.
This game is awesome! never get bored of it!
Classic.

This brings me back!

My room mate recently started replaying this game and seeing as Steam had it I bought it and started playing it again as well.   Ahhh~ The nolstagia is strong with this game.   Your main goal with this game is to build up and maintain a them park while following the guidelines of each level. Some start you from scratch, others don't. Anyway, it's a simple but complicated game as most Management type games go. For instance, can't make a roller coaster too scary or hardly anyone will ride it but if it's too weak, no one will want to ride it because it's not intense enough. Just be sure to Test Run your ride first to make sure it isn't a death trap. I've accidentally killed some people because I forgot to do that first. >_> Sometimes it's really hard to know if what you're building will appeal to your guests, but once you've got it right, advertise the crap out of your new ride, and watch the dollars signs fly up.  Anyway, this game is enjoyable and relaxing. If you likebuilding and maintaining and feeling powerful because you know how to maintain a park and make big bucks doing it, then this game is for you.   P.S. If you click on a stray balloon it will pop and if you click on a duck, it will quack. I didn't know about these fun little Easter Eggs until I bought it on Steam so I thought I would share that with you. :) Have fun!

I love this game when it works. I have a alienware gameing pc. It plays everything. But rollercoaster tycoon is the only game with the Access violation error. Which sometimes stops me from playing. I cant believe its a game from almost 20 years ago. I would recommend this to anyone if they would support the people with this error. I would hate to buy a game and not be able to play it. It never crashes for me. I have to run it in windowed or the video error will appear. And my pc is totally up to date. Just seems to updated for this game. Please keep this game up to the new IOS.

I've always liked that you can unlock different maps as you progress through the game, it's fun and it makes it feel like you're progressing as a tycoon, I suppose.   It's also fun to build death coasters and/or build only one bathroom and charge people ten dollars to use it.

When I was a kid I was amazed when I played a shareware version of 'Theme Park', that was fun and helped me to introduce myself to this Tycoon universe. A few years later, they've released this wonderful game called 'RollerCoaster Tycoon' that was simply awesome. The graphics were great, there were many attractions that you could build, a whole lot of scenarios and challenges to beat and of course, the chance of designing many different sorts of rides. There's only one thing that could have made this game better: A fast forward function. Because of that fact, I don't advise to play one scenario right after the other, play it casually, otherwise you might get bored.

'Your mom looks to intense for me' 'Just looking at Your Sister makes me feel sick'   This game is a real Classic Game,  If you want to remember your childhood, buy this game.  Still, really fun to play, graphics don't matter when playing this fun game.  10/10
good classic i played years ago an when seen it had to play again.

This game is really nostalgic to me, so finding it on here was a wonderful surprise. I would spend HOURS destroying peeps in various forms, and now I can do it all over again. :)  It's a really great game, and I recommend it. You can build your own roller coasters, change the names of rides (and even PEOPLE bahaha), and try to meet goals wth deadlines. Plus, this is the deluxe version so there's even more rides and themes to play with.   Also, there's certain names you can give people to make them do stuff. (For example, in RCT3 you can name someone 'makemesick' and everyone will puke. Not sure if that works in this game, but I'll letcha know. ;)

It may not be as amazing as it's sequel, RollerCoaster Tycoon 2, but it is still a joy to play. If you've ever wanted to own an amusement park or build your own roller coaster, this is the game for you.

I can easily say that this game was my childhood. I bought the game at the full price of $6 because I decided I couldn't wait until it went on sale, and honestly I regret it.  Immediately upon launching it for the very first time, it caused my laptop's video driver to crash. I was a little alarmed as my laptop is stronger than many gaming desktops out there, but brushed it off once a restart of my laptop got it working. Immediately I was reminded why I loved this game: it's fun and reminded me of everything that I used to love about the RollerCoaster series.  Downloading and launching the game on my desktop the following day, I was pleased when there were no problems... except why can't I play it in fullscreen? Ah well, I'll deal with it, at least it didn't crash funny on me like it did on my laptop.  Well then I encountered the horror story that I had read in a review - the 'save crash'. Upon saving my game after playing for two hours it crashed on me. Immediately the idea of logging back into that game and re-doing everything I   had just done   was frustrating.   But ultimately the part that really bothered me was Steams support for the game - read the supreme   lack   of support. Going through the support site here on Steam just wanted me to contact Atari.  Looking back, I feel that these were probably bugs that had been present in my original RCT, I vaguely remember problems with fullscreen mode working, and I definitely remember a video crash or too - at the time I had assumed it was my very, very outdated computer (it was classified as outdated in   2000   so it was definitely rather basic). The fact that these errors actually continued on to Steam was disheartening. I currently have an old scratched up CD of RCT; the reason I didn't shove that into my desktop and download it there was because I'd wrongly assumed that the one here would have these errors corrected. That was my fault.  Now, I'm not saying that the game is horrible - At the time of writing this I've put 4 hours into it, and I will continue to play. However, I would   highly   recommend waiting until it's on sale.
just as good as it was 15 years ago

Been playing on and off for several years now, a true classic!  Game play easy for anyone to pickup, if there is a bad negative point to the review it is that it looks a bit dated now.  If I am at a loss on a ageing computer, it never fails to boot and run like a dream.

First off it is a shame that there is no middle option for a review because this game is great and you should buy it... but it has one big flaw that lets it down hugely (skip to the bottom to see what that is if you don't want to read the whole thing. I would like to say that this is the type of game that makes you sit back and think 'I havn't played a game this fun and simple and really enjoyable in years', it is made to be fun which is a word not usually heard in video gaming these days.  As this is a game that you can buy on disc i will compare it to the disc version but first lets talk about the game on its own: It is a very happy game and definatly cheers me up, running a theme park is wierdly enjoyable and when you win the guests all clap for you (which is so cute, also if they are holding a balloon they let go and it fly's into the air (simply joys)), it has many different parks with a lot of variety in goals and map types, the graphics are still decent and the little sweeping activity the handmen do is very sweet, and if you are a phycopath then forcing the rides to fall off the rails makes a great explosion.  Now lets start comparing Pros of Steam version: It has a lot more variety of maps includng real world parks, there are more variety of rides, making banners is fun, also (only fans of the disc version will understand) you can set the price of all the burger stand to be the same price and not have to go round changing them all. Cons of the steam version: It may just be with my version but you can't see what the rides will look like untill they are built (except for the original rides that were on the original disc version) this is very annoying as i don't know what the ride is at all or if it will be similar to previous rides i have or if it will be too extreme for my guests.  Also, most of the new rides are far to big for any park and are too exspensive to be able to build. It is a shame that they have this variety of new ride designs but it is impossible to use this feature.  If you liked the original disc version when you were younger then get this, it will be quite the nostalga ride and I look forward to seeing you at the exit saying 'Rollarcoaster tycoon 1 was great!' (if you get my reference to the game)
My guests sure enjoy the 9/11 simulator.

It's impressive how a game I played as a 7 year old is just as fun if not more as a 22 year old.  Started playing at about 3pm, looked at the time on my computer and it was 6am.  11/10 would waste my life again.

Roller Coaster Tycoon is a lot of fun, the diverse variety of scenarios are all fun and interesting. the game is a little challenging but not enragingly so and after a while I found it a little relaxing. In the game they have many different parks you can build at with many different rides many of which allow you to build custom tracks. Lots of color customation, once had a tiger stripes themed amusement park. This game was made in 2000 so graphics are obviously no longer state-of-the-art but the game is well done and has almost no faults or glitches. In-game interface a little confusing but you learn it quickly. This game in my mind was the best of the entire Roller Coaster Tycoon series. Well worth the price.

Loved this game as a kid, played it all the time. Playing it again all these years is just as fun as it was the first time!  Only issue with the game is that while its running fullscreen, it messes with my system in multiple ways, such as not allowing me to access other programs after alt+tabbing, meaning that unless I play in windowed mode, I can't use Skype on the side, or even navigate the desktop without use of Task Manager or the Start menu. But it's a minor complaint I can over look.
An absolute classic. I love this game and was excited to find it on steam. I used to play it all the time as a child, but its even better as an adult!
This game is plain perfect! This classic game will amuse 98% of the players who play it. Don't be that 2%.

I used to play this on Windows 98, it's as good as it was years ago. I still have the CD-ROM, though this version comes with all the expansions. To 100% this game, it takes quite a ♥♥♥♥ ton of time but the challenges are fun.  If you're unsure about it, wait for a sale, it usually goes for 2 bucks.

I already own the original game but I decided to buy it on here for the convenience of having it on steam  Before I bought it, I had hoped that Atari would have done some light overhauling of the game to make it more fit for modern computers by enabing higher resolutions, adding the ability to save unlocked parks to steam, steam overlay support and just general compatibility improvements. But they've not done any of that, it's just the same as the original, so any technical issues you have with the original, you're going to have with this version too. Most of the time it runs without any issues, but remember that this game was originally written for Windows 95.  If you already own the original game, this is not really worth it as you're not paying for an overhauled version like you may be hoping. You're literally just getting ripped off by paying up for the exact same thing again. It feels a bit like they've just gotten a cracked version of the game and stuck it up on here for sale.   Also, this is the US version of the game, so it uses the US park and ride names. It doesn't support all the same languages that the UK/EU version did. Swedish is missing, for example.  With that said, this is one of my favourite childhood games and is still an excellent games that will serve you with countless hours of enjoyment. If you don't have the original discs, go ahead and buy it!
I have nothing bad to say about this game, it's a masterpiece. I'm running it on Win7 64 without any problems.

This is one of the games I've grown up with, running a successful theme park can be satisfying at best as well as being a sadistic person can torture the guest and making terrible rides on purpose can also be satisfying as well. This game is one of those that has aged very well. This game is moddable via trainers which are made by other people. Despite this being able to get this off steam, the dreaded 'error trapper' still exist at the worst of times. I can't say for sure about the sequels since I've never played them but I pretty much prefer this installment.

The Steam version is incredibly unstable, I recommend getting this off of GoG (Well I recommend RC2 with OpenRCT2 program). You can't alt tab on Steam and after closing program I had a tough time regaining control of my browser, while also having to relog on Steam due to Steam becoming pixelated and unresponsive. It isn't very optimized or brought up for new video cards or operating systems or whatever the problem is, just a forwarning. I mean it was 2 bucks anyways, right?  That being said this is obviously a classic, I played this game for so many hours as a kid and it's incredibly fun 17 years later.
If after many many years you start allover and can play well over 200 hours and not get bored, the game must be good. Now continuing to RCT 2...

I remember playing this game years and years ago, and had such a good time messing around in a park. I couldn't install it from disc on modern operating systems anymore, so I lost sight of it until the Steam Sale of this year. I immediately got this edition and all the nostalgia rushed back at me.   This game is very realistic and challenging, despite it being already sixteen years old. You need to be able to handle money and guest needs in order to reach the goal in every scenario. Do you loan more money? Would you rather custom build your own coasters or use prebuilt ones? Do you have enough mechanics and handymen to keep your park in working order? Are the guests happy? There is a lot to take into consideration, and that is what makes this game fun to play over and over again. Even after finishing a scenario you can simply try again differently if you wish. With many scenarios present in the Deluxe Edition, some with blank parks and some with pre-built parks, you can have a lot of fun.  For me it works on Windows 8 in fullscreen mode.
is prity gud

This game is what you call, a masterpiece. I have been playing this game since I was five years old when it was released in the Deluxe bundle at my local Target store. I usually played it everyday on my PC and at my Uncle's PC. Since I lost the disc for the game a long time ago, and I really miss playing the game, I would really love to play the game again, so as I was browsing the Steam store, and they have it. In my opinion, this game is totally fun. Managing the park seems to be pretty fun, and seeing what the guests want in your park can improve your park ratings. The only thing I don't like about this game is that amount of windows that are open, kind of gets annoying. Other than that, this game is a total masterpiece. I would call this game a family game, but since there is violence on coaster crashes, I would say a somewhat family game. My rating: 4.9/5
the game is cool but would be cooler in 3D but maybe its a little bit cheap

This game is just as addictive as it was when I first played it.  You get many hours of content with this game. It is simple enough to get started with just enough features to make some wacky parks. Two major downsides for me are that the isometric camera makes it difficult to build at times and that it can also be frustrating when you have to work with the landscaping. However, if you stick to it, you'll get used to it. If it gives you any trouble starting up on Windows 7 or beyond, adjust the compatibility settings. Enjoy!
I do like it! i really reccomend this game for something classic. I reccomend it if you like something old their great and i am loving it.
Absolute classic, one of the best of its genre
This is just as fun as it was over fifteen years ago. If you grew up with this game like me, get it.

Absolute classic game. I still play it. I originally had it on a CD from years and years ago as a kid. so my play time is a bit deceptive. Once you figure out the system its easy. Definitely have ended scenarios with 200k company value. Great game. Wish there was a speed up button because once you hit a certain point you realize your park is practically invincible barring a ride crash.
This is one of the best games I played growing up. I still play it to this day and enjoy as much as I used to.

Oh, Rollercoaster Tycoon. My childhood in all of it's glory of crashing train cars, dirty parks, and stupidly easy to obtain profits. Nothing about this game is particulary challenging, and building your own coasters from scratch is tedious as hell, but it's all rewarding in it's own way. It's stupid fun even now, over fifteen years after it's initial release. I just wish I didn't have to mess with my resolution settings every time I wanted to play.
10/10 Gives you hours upon hours of gameplay, from building super coasters and drowning your guests. Would buy again.
Seriously a great game.

RollerCoaster Tycoon: Deluxe is timeless, fun and a great nostalgic trip.  Offers tons of hours on end of challenge and let's you get creative with Coaster Designs.  IMO the first in it's genre to set standards for how a base RollerCoaster Management/Sandbox game should be.  Graphics are top and don't age I think, solid color palette for a 2D game.  Gameplay is repetitive to an extent but you're playing a Sandbox RollerCoaster Tycoon game... if this isn't what you are looking for it's your fault.  You can waste tons of hours at this game but always feel accomplished if it says : Congratulation! Please enter your name here.  Buy it if you like this type of stuff, or buy the 2nd one in the series, but I have not played that so I can't say if it's better/worse, for me this game is good enough and feel satisfied.
Not sure how I found out about this game but I will always love it.   10/10 will charge for the bathroom again
RollerCoaster Tycoon is one of those games I always find myself coming back to. It's actually somehow aged better than I have.
Probably the best sim game of all time and still holds up to this day
Still got the magic. I remember playing this in the nineties for hours.  One caveat though: it tends to play haywire with my Windows 7. Rebooting after long play sessions is recommended.

I've been playing this game for years. I've recently picked up rct3, and while it's fun, it still doesn't compare to the classic that this is. Definitely check this game out if you can.

tbh this is one of the best game in the roller coaster tycoon franchise. its wroth it getting this game even though it can have a price tag of $6 USD and even its $1.75 price tag during the winter sale.

This was the first real computer game I ever remember playing (I was probably about six or seven) and it's still a ton of fun. I still have an original physical copy, but I figured I'd get the Steam version for the expansion packs. It runs awesome on Windows 10 assuming you can install DirectPlay as easily as I was able to. 10/10 RTC is an utter classic. I'm excited for Planet Coaster when it's been thoroughly updated (*cough* what's Rollercoaster Tycoon World? Pff). It's cool to play the first game in the franchise for the nostalgia, though.
